p:
After the rats were anaesthetised and sacrificed with pentobarbital sodium, the uterus and ovaries were immediately collected, and the surrounding connective tissues and lipids were carefully removed. The weight and the coefficient of the uterus and the ovary were calculated. After weighing one side of the uterus and the ovaries, these were stored in a −80 °C freezer, whereas the other side of the uterus was fixed in 10% formalin.
Uterine coefficient = Uterine wet weight ( g ) / Rat body weight ( g )
×
100 %
Ovarian coefficient = Ovarian wet weight ( g ) / Rat body weight ( g )
×
100 %
